title: Stopped receiving emails into my inboxes
content:
Hi All,

2 Days ago, I stopped receiving all emails into my 5 inboxes with Thunderbird on Windows 11 desktop.

Tried some troubleshhoting including updating to the latest version of Thunderbird version 128.7.1esr (64-bit) on desktop for Windows 11, and turning VPN off and on.

Would appreciate any troubleshooting ideas to get emails flowing again.

Thank you
creator: TC-7

title: Security Devices in Thunderbird on macOS
content:
On Thunderbird on macOS, I am trying to use a Security Device to client certificates made available by the OS for TLS authentication to IMAP servers and S/MIME signing and encryption. Under Security Devices, there is no Security Device that provides this functionality so in Security Devices I click Load and Browse... and select /Applications/Thunderbird.app/Contents/MacOS/libosclientcerts.dylib to add the appropriate security device. However, when I click okay, I get "Alert" "Unable to add module" . What am I doing wrong?

I also use libosclientcerts.dylib in Firefox just fine. Why is it not working in Thunderbird?
creator: rossmpersonal

title: thunderbird forgot accounts and local folders
content:
I tried restarting thunderbird after restoring from a backup (I had a disk issue). The profile is there in .thunderbird, with all the account information and local folders, but for some reason thunderbird can't find it. I tried deleting the cache, pointing the import wizard at a copy of the original profile -- all without any success. I can see the folders there with their data, and the account information. Why is thunderbird 128.6.0esr ignoring its data?

Thanks.

title: E-posta Alım Sorunu Hakkında
content:
Merhaba,

Erse Tekstil bünyesinde bulunan ... kullanıcımız, ... adresinden gelen e-postaları Thunderbird uygulaması üzerinden görüntüleyememektedir. Gelen e-postalar web mail üzerinde sorunsuz bir şekilde görüntülenebilirken, Thunderbird’e yalnızca Erse Tekstil’den gelen e-postalar düşmektedir. Ancak Cellion Tekstil’den gelen e-postalar uygulamada görünmemektedir.

Bu durumun sebebinin belirlenmesi ve sorunun giderilmesi için gerekli kontrollerin yapılmasını rica ederiz. Konu hakkında desteklerinizi bekliyoruz.

Teşekkürler, İyi çalışmalar.

title: My thunderbird seems to only index my sent folders since a while
content:
I am using Thunderbird 128.7.1 on Windows, have several mailboxes (POP and Imap) with many sub-folders and large email archives (~20 years of emails) under "Local Folders". Indexing used to work fine over all those folders and I liked it a lot, in particular the timeline view on global searches.

Now, since a while (not sure for how long) indexing only looks into all my "Sent" folders, and not any of the incoming folders or local folders. I see that in all the global searches I try now. Note, whenever I archive a large amount of emails, I delete global-messages-db.sqlite and re-start TB to make sure the index gets re-built to match the real folder content. Previously global-messages-db.sqlite had a few GB in size, not it does not get larger than ~100MB.

How can I tell TB to index all folders as it used to do?
creator: deherrdoktor

title: thunderbird freezes when using "until: forever" events in Calendar
content:
Hi, I´ve installed Thunderbird today, clean installation (no prior installation). So it´s 128.7.1esr (64-bit) version on top of my Windows10 Pro fully updated.

I´ll use Thunderbird just to manage my personal agenda in Calendar, I won´t be using the email part so I didn´t configure the email client.

When I create a recurring event with due date "forever" the app starts lagging so badly, and when ir finally creates the events, if I change any of them (for example I drag it to another hour) the whole app freezes and I need to close it from Task Manager. I´ve tried to let it working for a while, and when I´m back it eventually completed the change, but I don´t know how long it takes. After closing with TaskManager, I see the change has been applied.

I´ve followed this instructions to run in Troubleshoot Mode https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird#w_start-thunderbird-in-troubleshoot-mode

And it works!! in Troubleshoot Mode, and more specifically disabling add-ons the Calendar works just fine. BUT, the problem is, I´m using a clean installation: I haven no add-ons at all, and only the 3 default themes that can not be deleted/disabled.

How can I fix this? or I´m forced to enter in Troubleshoot Mode every time? Maybe a previous version is better for using the Calendar alone, without an email account?

BTW I´ve dissabled the hardware acceleration, just in case, but it didn´t help.

Thanks for your help!!!
creator: temperie

title: I've broken Thunderbird - no messages in my folders now, when make new folder and move message not showing - help!
content:
I am no tech genius and am struggling....

I have an old laptop (L1) and now have a new laptop (L2) - wanted to make my Thunderbird messages (POP account) accessible on both so installed Thunderbird on L2. The problem I then had was that if messages went to L1 or my phone they didn't come through to L2. So I went into my gmail through google on L1 and changed my POP settings, not really knowing what I was doing. I changed it to 'Enable POP for all mail (even mail that's already been downloaded)' and 'Keep Gmail's copy in the Inbox'.

This resulted in every email I'd ever had since setting up my Gmail reloading into my inbox (20K messages!) on L1. I now get new messages on both laptops however nothing is showing in any of my L1 Inbox subfolders (I had everything nicely filed...), and on top of this if I make a new subfolder the folder appears but if I moves a message from inbox to that folder the message disappears i.e., it's not visible....

I restarted Thunderbird after this and got an error message 'Couldn't load XPCOM' but I can still see all my inbox messages so seems to be starting up OK but the folder problem persists. It's maddening as I can't sort out my 20K messages into manageable folders....

I'd really like to understand - in an explanation fit for a tech dunderhead - what's going on. Both to fix it, and to stop the same thing ever happening in my Thunderbird on L2....

It'd be much appreciated if someone could help me unravel :)
creator: Nears
